label: 足柄
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A mountainous region in Sagami-no-kuni. The Tōkaidō ran through these mountains up a long slope called the Ashigara-zaka to a mountain pass, known as the Ashigara-tōge, which was defended by the barrier (seki) called the Ashigara-no-seki.↓ [相模国、東海道、足柄坂、足柄峠、関、足柄関]
